name: 2013 Vermentino
description:
Now Available

Traditionally grown in Sardinia, Corsica, and on the Ligurean Coast of Italy, where the grape thrives in hot conditions, Vermentino is finding a new home in Australia.  Our 2013 Vermentino grows in view of South Australia's Gulf St Vincent in the McLaren Vale region.

Our best Vermentino yet!

Seriously intense flavours of  grapefruit and preserved lemon with aromas of wattle blossom. The palate is long and textural with a salty sea-breeze minerality. It is quite something!

Tony Love (National Winewriter for News Limited) in SAWeekend 30/11/13  has said...
"Ducks in a Row 2013 Vermentino ($25) which has a delightful oceanic, briny note with ozone energy and tasty yellow grapefruit flavours with a dash of pith bitterness."

name: 2011 Fiano
description:
Ducks in a Row Fiano 2010 is like a fresh Thai Papaya Salad with hints of hazelnut and smoke, and a“selvatico (savage) quality that sets it apart.”

Traditionally grown on the southern coast of Italy, particularly in the Campania region, our Fiano is from new plantings in Heathcote, Victoria.

Wine maker Glenn James Pritchard describes this wine as "one of the best wines I have ever made"

Latest News...
Our Fiano has been listed in 'Best of Other Whites & Blends' in James Halliday 2014 Australian Wine Companion  - "A streak of minerality underpins the texture and structure, adding to the salivating effect; exceptional length." - James Halliday 95 points; drink to 2016.

name: 2012 Pandora's Amphora
description:
The follow up release of our highly acclaimed hand-crafted Amphora-made wine from a blend of Heathcote Fiano, Vermentino and Moscato Giallo grapes.

500 bottles produced only.

Hand harvested and fermented together on skins in a single 600 litre Terracotta Amphora for 200 days then matured in a single old French oak puncheon. Bottled unfiltered and with minimal SO2.

Tony Love (National Wine writer for News Limited) said in SAWEEKEND 30/11/13...

"It's got a vanilla, ginger, cinnamon and mace spice lift, with subtle fruit profile and more about mouth feel, sticky rather than minerally in its grip, and satisfyingly softly touched in the finish."

Our 2011 release was awarded Best Emerging White in The Age/Sydney Morning Herald 2013 Good Wine Guide. Nick Stock described the wine as "A landmark wine for Australia and a triumph for Glenn James."
and...
James Halliday 2014 Australian Wine Companion...  95 points and Best of the Best in Other Whites and Blends.
and...
2013 Australian Alternative Varieties Wine Show... Gold Medal

name: 2013 Ducks in a Rosé
description:
It's Ducks in a Rows' very  first Rosé

Our Rosé is complex and textured with fantastic rhubarb, strawberry and fresh cream flavours. Aromatic, very fresh and just lovely.

Made in the saignée method during vintage 2013. Natural ferment, lees stirred for four months prior to bottling.

A limited amount of cases produced this year (700 bottles).

name: 2011 Nero D'Avola
description:
Nero D’Avola hails from the hot, sunny and dry vineyards of Sicily, the largest island in the Mediterranean where they create wines that have inspired our winemaker, Glenn James-Pritchard.

The ancient, red, rocky, volcanic soils in the driest, most northern part of Heathcote form the perfect site for Australia’s introduction to Nero D’Avola.

“The hand picked, perfectly ripened fruit was de-stemmed to a single open fermenter; cold soaked, fermented on skins for two weeks and matured in 700 litre demi muids.” - Glenn James-Pritchard, Winemaker.

"... explodes in the mouth, intensely spicy yet savoury, red and sour cherry competing for space... Hard to imagine a better lunch wine." 
 - James Halliday 94 Points; drink to 2020.

"Glenn James is a crafty winemaker...Here Nero D'Avola appears brightly flavoured, lighter form with amaro herb spice and cranberry acidity. It's delicious, vibrant drinking personified."
Mike Bennie 93 Points

name: 2010 Straight Up Mataro
description:
Straight Up Mataro, named after the Mataro vine’s vertical inclination, is a wine heady with floral herbs of kitchen gardens and elderflowers. A core of bramble fruits and blueberries hold it’s terrestrial, earthy characters and muscular structure. 

Straight Up is made from a patch of 63 year-old McLaren Vale vines grown in the Urrbrae Loam soils that lay beneath the Willunga escarpment.


James Halliday in his just released 2014 Australian Wine Companion has just agreed giving this wine 94 points saying...

"Made from a single planting of 63-year-old vines in McLaren Vale. It is medium- to full-bodied, with masses of dark/black fruits, with a density to the flavour and mouthfeel greater than the other reds, although not Pandora's Amphora. There are also licorice and dark chocolate flavours with inbuilt tannins... drink by 2040"

Tony Love (National Winewriter for News Limited) said in SAWeekend 30/11/13...

"2010 Straight Up Mataro is meaty, rich and mouth-filling with a full bodied opening stance that shapes gently to medium bodied in the finish. Buy a great steak and you'll be totally convinced."

name: Our Perfect Summer Dozen
description:
Four of our wines that suit the summer heat and the food your eating!

Three each of ...

2013 McLaren Vale Vermentino 
2013 McLaren Vale Rosé (Tempranillo/Mataro)
2011 Heathcote Fiano (don't worry about vintage... its really lovely and fresh!)
2011 Heathcote Nero D'Avola 

Free shipping within Australia!

name: Ducks in a Row Mixed Dozen
description:
3 x 2013 Vermentino
3 x 2011 Fiano
3 x 2011 Nero D'Avola
3 x 2010 Straight Up Mataro

Free Postage within Australia

name: Tempranillo Graciano Mataro
description:
This wine is sold out!

Latest News...

James Halliday in his just released 2014 Australian Wine Companion has given this wine 96 Points and placed the wine in "Best of Other Reds and Blends" saying...
"The colour is deep, the bouquet with strong black fruit aromas, and the seemingly inevitable touch of dark chocolate; a strong spice character runs through the palate, originally with red pepper, ageing into green pepper; outstanding tannin management is the key to an exceptionally good wine, one of the magic touches being a late decision to include the mataro in the blend, making it a complete wine."

“All grapes were hand picked; small batch fermented and basket pressed before being blended and matured in old hogsheads. The vibrancy of Graciano is integral to balance the low acidity of Tempranillo and the Mataro adds further depth, structure and savoury qualities. It’s a hedonistic glimpse of McLaren Vale.”
-Glenn James-Pritchard, winemaker.
